prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would. What is $2343_6+15325_6$? Express your answer in base $6$.
solution: Adding the first digits, we get $8$, hence $2$ after carrying. Adding the next two digits plus one, we get $1$, with carrying. Adding the next two digits plus one, we get $1$, again with carrying. Adding the next two digits plus one, we get $2$, with carrying. Finally, adding $1$ to one, we get $2$. Thus our final answer is $\boxed{22112_6}$.
gpt_response:
To add $2343_6$ and $15325_6$, we can stack the two numbers on top of each other and then add the columns starting from the right.

\[
\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c}
& & 2& 3 & 4 & 3_6 \\
+ & 1 & 5 & 3 & 2 & 5_6 \\
\hline
& 2 & 1 & 3 & 5 & 2_6 \\
\end{array}
\]

Therefore, $2343_6 + 15325_6 = 21352_6$ in base $6$.
solution_prompt:
Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to 22112_6?: To add $2343_6$ and $15325_6$, we can stack the two numbers on top of each other and then add the columns starting from the right.

\[
\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c}
& & 2& 3 & 4 & 3_6 \\
+ & 1 & 5 & 3 & 2 & 5_6 \\
\hline
& 2 & 1 & 3 & 5 & 2_6 \\
\end{array}
\]

Therefore, $2343_6 + 15325_6 = 21352_6$ in base $6$.
